43.heading: Udall, Ted.
43.title: All Star Comics Archives. v. 3
43.author: foreword by Roy Thomas.
notes: Collects the Justice Society and Hop Harrigan stories from All Star Comics #11-14 (1942-1943).

Stories in this collection were written by Gardner Fox and Sheldon Mayer, and drawn by Jack Burnley, Sheldon Moldoff, Harry G. Peter, Cliff Young, Ben Flinton, Howard Sherman, Stan Asch, Bernard Klein, Bernard Baily, Joe Gallagher, Lou Ferstadt, Pierce Rice, Jack Kirby, Joe Simon, and Howard Ferguson. Editors are Sheldon Mayer and Ted Udall. Brief biographies are presented at the end of the volume.

132.heading: Ueda, Rinko, 1970-
132.title: Hômu = Home
132.author: Ueda Rinko.
notes: Summary (by Adelyn Geissel): Upon the arrival of a Japanese delegation to Spain in 1614, Maria, who is ever hounded by Antonio, sees the Japanese for the first time. In her efforts to help one of the members of the Japanese delegation, she travels to Japan along with a Japanese man she has befriended, Kojirô. The female character is more outgoing and boisterous than would be expected in the period in which the story takes place.

140.heading: Ueyama, Tochi.
140.title: Kukkingu Papa = Cooking Papa
140.author: Ueyama Tochi.
notes: Summary (from Ohio State University): Araiwa Kazumi is chief of a section of the sales department at Kanemaru Sangyo, which is based in Hakata, Kyushu district. He is married to a woman who is working at a local newpaper company. They seem to be an ordinary couple, except for one secret that Araiwa wants to hide
he loves to cook. As his wife is not good at housekeeping, he does almost everything in his house and he also makes people around him happy with his cooking skills.

notes: Statements about and samples of the comics of Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovnia, Croatia, Czech Republic, Estonia, Hungary, Lithuania, Macedonia, Poland, Russia, Slovenia, Ukraine, and Yugoslavia.

301.heading: Ukrainian Comic Books, Strips, etc.
301.title: Stripburek : Comics from the Other Europe.
301.author: [No author]
notes: Statements about and samples of the comics of Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Estonia, Hungary, Macedonia, Poland, Romania, Russia, Slovenia, Ukraine, and Yugoslavia.

302.heading: Ukrainian Samovar Salesmen.
302.title: "Hard Fight Mom, I'll Be Right Home"
302.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Afterwards the boys bring Uncle Bulgy home in a wagon, and the Major's head is spinning as he asks the conductor to refer to him at the iron curtain as a Ukrainian samovar salesman. A passer-by thinks he's drunk.
Key words: Spectators, hail on a tin roof, punches, sponges.

304.heading: Ukuleles.
304.title: The Blank in the Comics strip collection includes a file of one or more daily comic strips related to this keyword or topic. Call no.: PN6726 f.B55
304.author: [No author]

305.heading: Ukuleles.
305.title: "Don't You Play Anything Noisier?"
305.author: Ketcham.
notes: Summary: Mr. Wilson is on the front steps with his ukulele, and Dennis comments.

306.heading: Ukuleles.
306.title: "He's Not Quite That Bad, Martha"
306.author: Bill Freyse.
notes: Summary: The lawn chair business is working, and Amos gives Martha $15. The last time Martha got money from Amos was when she took the blame for his sitting on her father's ukulele.

307.heading: Ukuleles.
307.title: "I Might've Needed That Electric Ukelele!"
307.author: Roy Schneider.
notes: Summary: They had to sacrifice some other cargo in order to bring Grisman the dog along.

308.heading: Ukuleles.
308.title: "Pop Never Plays It Any More"
308.author: Al Vermeer.
notes: Summary: Rev. Weems is soliciting aid to send a missionary to the South Seas, and Priscilla offers a ukelele.

309.heading: Ukuleles.
309.title: "A Reward for Daring!"
309.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Tommy takes the plane low, almost into the ocean, before the motor restarts, and it's on to Hawaii and its ukeleles.
